topic: Node.js Queue Libraries with Redis/Valkey Backend

sources.title: BullMQ Official Documentation - Home
keyInsights: BullMQ attempts exactly-once delivery, guarantees at-least-once
Polling-free design using Redis blocking commands
High throughput via Lua scripts and pipelining
Automatic recovery from process crashes

sources.title: Bull GitHub Repository - README
keyInsights: Bull is in maintenance mode, BullMQ recommended for new features
Supports multiple job types per queue
Requires Redis >= 2.8.18
Three Redis connections per queue instance (client, subscriber, bclient)

sources.title: Bee-Queue GitHub Repository - README
keyInsights: Simple, fast, robust design philosophy
~1000 lines of code with minimal dependencies
At-least-once delivery with stalling detection via heartbeat
No priorities, no repeatable jobs - trades breadth for performance
BRPOPLPUSH for atomic job fetch

sources.title: BullMQ Architecture Guide
keyInsights: Job states: wait, delayed, prioritized, active, waiting-children, completed, failed
Priority range 0 to 2^21, lower number = higher priority
Jobs without priority processed before prioritized jobs
FlowProducer creates parent-child dependencies atomically

sources.title: BullMQ Delayed Jobs Guide
keyInsights: Delayed jobs placed in special 'delayed set' (sorted set)
Not guaranteed to process at exact delayed time, depends on worker busyness
changeDelay() allows rescheduling delayed jobs

sources.title: BullMQ Rate Limiting Guide
keyInsights: Global rate limiter across all workers (max jobs per duration)
Manual rate limiting via worker.rateLimit() for API 429 responses
Group rate limiting removed in BullMQ 3.0
QueueScheduler no longer required for rate limiting in v2+

sources.title: BullMQ Retry Guide
keyInsights: Fixed backoff: consistent delay between retries
Exponential backoff: 2^(attempts-1) * delay ms
Jitter option randomizes delay to prevent thundering herd
Custom backoff strategies via worker settings
Retried jobs respect priority when moved back to waiting

sources.title: BullMQ Flows Guide
keyInsights: FlowProducer atomically adds parent and child jobs across different queues
Parent enters 'waiting-children' state until all children complete
getDependencies() with pagination for processed/unprocessed/failed children
Removal cascades: parent removal deletes all children

sources.title: BullMQ Events Guide
keyInsights: Uses Redis Streams for event delivery (not Pub/Sub)
Streams provide guaranteed delivery during disconnections
Auto-trims to ~10,000 events by default
QueueEvents aggregates events from all workers

sources.title: BullMQ Concurrency Guide
keyInsights: Local concurrency factor determines parallel jobs per worker instance
At-least-once delivery maintained with concurrent processing
CPU-intensive work should use sandboxed processors

sources.title: BullMQ Repeatable Jobs Guide
keyInsights: Repeatable jobs are delayed jobs added according to cron/interval settings
Next execution generated when current job starts processing
Custom repeat strategies via repeatStrategy setting
Supports cron with optional seconds via cron-parser

sources.title: BullMQ Stalled Jobs Guide
keyInsights: Lock-based stall detection: worker must periodically renew lock
Stalled jobs moved back to waiting or to failed if max stalls exceeded
CPU congestion prevents timely lock renewal causing false stalls
Workers must return control to event loop to avoid stalling

sources.title: BullMQ Production Guide
keyInsights: maxmemory-policy MUST be noeviction
AOF persistence recommended with appendfsync everysec
maxRetriesPerRequest: null for workers, default for producers
Graceful shutdown via SIGTERM/SIGINT handlers
Encrypt sensitive job data before queuing

sources.title: BullMQ Lua Command Scripts Directory
keyInsights: 53 Lua scripts for all atomic operations
Key scripts: addStandardJob, moveToActive, moveToFinished, moveStalledJobsToWait
Lock management: extendLock, releaseLock scripts
Cleanup: obliterate, cleanJobsInSet, drain scripts

sources.title: BullMQ moveToActive Lua Script
keyInsights: Uses RPOPLPUSH to atomically move job from wait to active list
11 Redis keys involved: wait, active, prioritized, events stream, stalled, etc.
Rate limiting check before job fetch
Token-based lock assignment with configurable duration
Falls back to prioritized sorted set if wait list is empty

sources.title: BullMQ moveToFinished Lua Script
keyInsights: 14 Redis keys involved in completion
Lock verification before state transition
LREM from active, ZADD to completed/failed with timestamp
Atomically fetches next job via RPOPLPUSH after completing current
Metrics collection on completion

sources.title: BullMQ addStandardJob Lua Script
keyInsights: 9 keys: wait, paused, meta, ID counter, completed, delayed, active, events, marker
Job ID generated by incrementing counter key
LIFO via RPUSH, FIFO via LPUSH
Handles parent-child dependencies and deduplication

sources.title: BullMQ promoteDelayedJobs Lua Script
keyInsights: ZRANGEBYSCORE on delayed set to find ready jobs
Score encoding: (timestamp + 1) * 0x1000 - 1
Priority 0 jobs LPUSH to wait, others ZADD to prioritized
Processes up to 1000 delayed jobs per invocation
Emits 'waiting' event for each promoted job

sources.title: BullMQ RedisConnection Class Source
keyInsights: Valkey detection via line.includes('valkey_version:') || line.includes('server:Valkey')
Minimum Redis version: 5.0.0, recommended: 6.2.0
Exponential backoff retry strategy (1-20 seconds)
Redis Cluster detection and option extraction
maxRetriesPerRequest set to null for blocking operations

sources.title: BullMQ QueueKeys Class Source
keyInsights: 17 key types: active, wait, waiting-children, paused, delayed, prioritized, completed, failed, stalled, repeat, limiter, meta, events, pc, marker, de, id
Pattern: {prefix}:{queueName}:{keyType}
Default prefix is 'bull'

sources.title: BullMQ Worker Class Source
keyInsights: Uses BZPOPMIN blocking command for efficient job waiting
AsyncFifoQueue orchestrates job fetching and processing
LockManager with token-based tracking and AbortController integration
Stalled checker runs at minimum 30-second intervals
Rate limit and delay management via limitUntil and blockUntil timestamps

sources.title: BullMQ Connections Guide
keyInsights: Uses ioredis module for Redis connectivity
QueueScheduler and QueueEvents require dedicated blocking connections
Avoid ioredis keyPrefix option; use BullMQ's prefix instead
maxmemory-policy must be noeviction

sources.title: BullMQ Redis Compatibility Page
keyInsights: Requires Redis 6.2.0 or newer for full feature support
Several Redis alternatives exist but not all work properly
BullMQ regularly tests vendor compatibility

sources.title: BullMQ Dragonfly Compatibility
keyInsights: Dragonfly supported as drop-in replacement
Queue names must use curly braces for multi-core optimization
Priorities and rate limiting may not work across split queues

sources.title: BullMQ GitHub Issues - Valkey
keyInsights: CI tests for Valkey added Oct 2024 (PR #2794)
Open request for Valkey Glide client support (#3083)
Broader initiative to migrate to official node-redis (#2490)
ElastiCache serverless compatibility issues noted

sources.title: BullMQ Prioritized Jobs Guide
keyInsights: Priority range: 1 to 2,097,152
Jobs without priority processed before prioritized jobs
O(log N) insertion complexity for prioritized jobs
Same-priority jobs processed in FIFO order
Dynamic priority change via changePriority()

sources.title: BullMQ Job IDs Guide
keyInsights: Auto-generated IDs are increasing counters per queue
Custom IDs prevent duplicate submissions
Uniqueness scoped per queue
Custom IDs cannot contain colons

sources.title: BullMQ Deduplication Guide
keyInsights: Three modes: Simple (until completion), Throttle (TTL window), Debounce (replace)
Deduplication ID is user-provided string
Emits 'deduplicated' event when duplicate detected
Operates at queue level before job enters processing

sources.title: BullMQ Parallelism Guide
keyInsights: IO-heavy: high concurrency (100-300) per worker
CPU-heavy: low concurrency, more workers (horizontal scaling)
Concurrency exploits NodeJS event loop for IO operations
Increasing concurrency decreases throughput for CPU-bound work

sources.title: BullMQ Global Concurrency Guide
keyInsights: Global concurrency is upper bound across all workers
Worker concurrency cannot exceed global limit
Simple API: setGlobalConcurrency(), getGlobalConcurrency(), removeGlobalConcurrency()

sources.title: BullMQ Sandboxed Processors Guide
keyInsights: Two models: child_process.spawn (default) and Worker Threads (v3.13+)
Prevents CPU work from blocking event loop and causing stalled jobs
Worker Threads less resource-demanding than spawn
Processor must be in separate file exporting async function

sources.title: BullMQ Metrics Guide
keyInsights: Tracks completed and failed jobs per minute
Stored in Redis lists with configurable retention
2 weeks of data = ~120KB per queue
Same metrics setting required across all workers for consistency

sources.title: BullMQ Auto-Removal Guide
keyInsights: removeOnComplete and removeOnFail options
Count-based limits, age-based retention, or both
Removal happens lazily when new jobs complete/fail
Removed jobs no longer detectable for deduplication

sources.title: BullMQ QueueScheduler (Deprecated)
keyInsights: QueueScheduler deprecated from BullMQ 2.0
Previously managed delayed job promotion and stalled job detection
Functionality integrated into workers in v2+

sources.title: BullMQ Introduction
keyInsights: Four main classes: Queue, Worker, QueueEvents, FlowProducer
Clean separation of concerns between producing and consuming
Workers can run across processes and machines

sources.title: BullMQ Job Schedulers Guide (v5)
keyInsights: Job Schedulers replace repeatable jobs in v5
upsertJobScheduler is idempotent for production deployments
Scheduler generates next job only when current starts processing
Supports cron, fixed intervals, and custom strategies

sources.title: BullMQ Pausing Queues Guide
keyInsights: Global pause: no workers pick up jobs from queue
Local pause: individual worker stops processing
Active jobs complete before pausing (unless forced)
Force pause option ignores running jobs

sources.title: BullMQ NestJS Integration Guide
keyInsights: @nestjs/bullmq package for official integration
@Processor decorator marks queue handler classes
@OnWorkerEvent for lifecycle event handlers
BullModule.forRoot() for connection, registerQueue() for queues

sources.title: BullMQ Changelog
keyInsights: v5.0.0: Breaking changes to connection handling and marker system
v5.67.0: OpenTelemetry metrics and tracing
v5.60.0: Global rate limiting support
v5.9.0: Global concurrency controls
v5.56.0: Deduplication with replace/extend options

sources.title: Bull Patterns Documentation
keyInsights: Three Redis connections per queue (can share client and subscriber)
Redis Cluster requires hash tags in curly braces
Custom backoff strategies return delay ms, 0 for immediate, -1 to fail
Manual job fetching pattern with getNextJob() and extendLock()

sources.title: Bull API Reference
keyInsights: lockDuration default 30000ms, lockRenewTime 15000ms, stalledInterval 30000ms
guardInterval 5000ms for delayed job polling
Priority: 1=highest, MAX_INT=lowest
Job timeout does not proactively kill jobs
KeepJobs interface with age (seconds) and count limits

sources.title: Bull Queue.js Source Code
keyInsights: Keys: wait, active, completed, failed, delayed, priority, stalled (lists/sorted sets)
Additional keys: id (counter), repeat, limiter, progress, meta-paused
Delayed scores encode timestamp * 0x1000 + (jobId & 0xfff)
Cannot use ioredis keyPrefix due to dynamic key creation in Lua

sources.title: Bee-Queue checkStalledJobs Lua Script
keyInsights: Uses stallBlock key with expiration for check locking
stalling set + active list + waiting list as key data structures
LPUSH (not RPUSH) for stalled jobs to prevent resource hogging
Three phases: lock check, recovery, snapshot of active jobs
maxUnpack limit of 1024 prevents Redis command overflow

sources.title: Bee-Queue addJob Lua Script
keyInsights: Three Redis keys: ID counter (INCR), jobs hash (HSET), waiting list (LPUSH)
All jobs stored in single hash (bq:name:jobs) vs BullMQ per-job hashes
HEXISTS check prevents duplicate job IDs
Atomic Lua transaction for consistent job creation

sources.title: Bee-Queue Queue.js Source Code
keyInsights: Key suffixes: jobs, waiting, active, failed, succeeded, delayed, stalling, stallBlock, events, earlierDelayed
BRPOPLPUSH for atomic job fetch (waiting -> active)
Three client types: primary, blocking (bclient), event subscriber (eclient)
Stall prevention via periodic heartbeat in _preventStall()
Graceful shutdown drains active jobs with Promise.all()

sources.title: Redis Sorted Sets Documentation
keyInsights: Skip list + hash table dual structure for O(log N) operations
ZADD O(log N), ZRANGEBYSCORE O(log N) - ideal for priority and delayed queues
Elements pre-ordered at insertion time
ZRANGEBYSCORE perfect for finding delayed jobs ready for execution

sources.title: Redis Lists Documentation
keyInsights: LPUSH/RPUSH O(1) - ideal for FIFO/LIFO job queues
BRPOPLPUSH atomically pops and pushes between lists
Blocking commands eliminate polling (BLPOP, BRPOP, BLMOVE)
LMOVE prevents race conditions in state transitions

sources.title: ioredis GitHub Repository
keyInsights: Lua scripting abstraction for custom commands
Pipelining support for batch operations
Cluster, Sentinel, Streams, Pub/Sub support
TypeScript-native, performance-focused
Compatible with Redis >= 2.6.12

sources.title: Valkey GitHub Repository
keyInsights: Open-source Redis fork under Linux Foundation
Forked before Redis license change
Creates redis-server/redis-cli symlinks for compatibility
Supports TLS, clustering, multiple allocators

sources.title: Valkey 8.0.0 GA Announcement
keyInsights: No backwards-incompatible changes to command syntax
Speed and memory efficiency improvements
Modified threading architecture
Production-ready certified by Technical Steering Committee

sources.title: Bull Board GitHub Repository
keyInsights: UI dashboard for Bull and BullMQ
Supports Express, Fastify, Koa, Hapi, NestJS, Hono, H3, Elysia
Read-only mode and visibility guards for multi-tenancy
Custom data formatters for sensitive information redaction

sources.title: Arena GitHub Repository
keyInsights: Web GUI for Bee-Queue, Bull, and BullMQ
Queue health, job pagination, filtering, stack traces
Standalone or Express middleware deployment
Docker image available

sources.title: Kue GitHub Repository (Deprecated)
keyInsights: No longer maintained, use Bull/BullMQ instead
5 priority levels: critical, high, medium, normal, low
Built-in web UI with search and progress tracking
TTL support for active jobs

sources.title: Node-Resque GitHub Repository
keyInsights: Compatible with Ruby Resque API
Three components: Queue, Worker, Scheduler
Requires Redis >= 2.6.0
Implements resque-scheduler and resque-retry plugins

sources.title: RedisSMQ GitHub Repository
keyInsights: FIFO, LIFO, and Priority queue types
Exchange patterns: Direct, Topic, Fanout
Built-in REST API with Swagger UI
Supports both ioredis and @redis/client

sources.title: Agenda GitHub Repository
keyInsights: MongoDB/PostgreSQL backend (not Redis)
Human-readable scheduling intervals
Pluggable notification channels including Redis Pub/Sub
v6 TypeScript rewrite, ESM-only

sources.title: Better-Queue GitHub Repository
keyInsights: Local queue (not Redis-based)
Batched processing, task merging/filtering
Extensible storage backends
No external dependencies required

sources.title: BullMQ Multi-Step Job Processing Pattern
keyInsights: Step tracking via job.updateData() persistence
Failed jobs resume from last saved step on retry
moveToDelayed() and moveToWaitingChildren() for flow control
maxStartedAttempts controls total processing starts
